definition[0]: if two or more people do something together, they do it with each other
example[0]: We’ve very much enjoyed working together.
example[1]: They’ve decided to spend more time together.
example[2]: He and my father were at school together.
example[3]: Together they went back inside the villa.
definition[1]: if you put two or more things together, you join them so that they touch or form one whole thing or group
example[4]: He’d tried to glue the broken pieces together.
example[5]: Mix the butter and sugar together.
example[7]: He took the engine apart and then put it back together again.
example[8]: The model was held together with string.
definition[2]: if two people are together, they are married, or are having a romantic or sexual relationship
example[9]: Mark and I have been together eight years now.
example[11]: A lot of people live together before getting married.
example[12]: Sometimes I don’t know what keeps us together.
definition[3]: if you keep, collect etc things together, you keep or collect them all in one place
example[13]: She keeps all the important documents together in one file.
example[14]: Embarrassed, she gathered her things together and left.
example[15]: Goods of a similar kind should be stored together.
definition[4]: if you rub or hit things together, you rub or hit them against each other
example[16]: Max was rubbing his hands together with glee.
example[17]: Knock the brushes together to clean them.
definition[5]: if people are together, come together etc, they are or become united, especially in order to try and achieve something
example[19]: The Conference called on all good men to come together to resist socialism.
example[20]: He said that the main purpose of the Baha'i faith was to bring people together.
example[21]: Both letters should have arrived. I mailed them together.
example[23]: Right men. All together now ... push!
definition[6]: when two amounts or quantities are added together, they are combined
example[24]: Add these numbers together and then divide the total by 7.
example[25]: Together they won only 21% of the votes.
example[26]: The table and chairs are together worth about £200.
definition[7]: someone who is together is confident, thinks clearly, and does things in a sensible organized way – used to show approval
example[27]: Jane is such a together person.
